sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The sysclock statement is used on a multitasking system such as UNIX to determine the amount of time that has been used by this program (process). Variable c is assigned the number of central processor milliseconds assigned to this program. This is of little use on a personal computer, where sysclock returns the same value as clock.
sections.text_content: The sysclock statement is used on a multitasking system such as UNIX to determine the amount of time that has been used by this program (process). Variable c is assigned the number of central processor milliseconds assigned to this program. This is of little use on a personal computer, where sysclock returns the same value as clock.
sections.mdown_content: The **sysclock** statement is used on a multitasking system such as UNIX to determine the amount of time that has been used by this program (process). Variable _c_ is assigned the number of central processor milliseconds assigned to this program. This is of little use on a personal computer, where **sysclock** returns the same value as **clock**.

sections.title: Example
code:
var timeUsed : int
        sysclock ( timeUsed )
        put "This program has used ", timeUsed,
                " milliseconds of CPU time"
sections.raw_content: On a UNIX system, this program tells you how much time it has used.
sections.text_content: On a UNIX system, this program tells you how much time it has used.
sections.mdown_content: On a UNIX system, this program tells you how much time it has used.

See also predefined unit Time.
